items.content_html: I’m super sad to learn that Rain Shadow Meats is closing. Our office just moved to Pioneer Square and I was looking forward to getting their wonderful porchetta sandwich from time to time.
I’m wanting to get into scripting a bit more, and this new trick from Brett Terpstra will be a great way to spin up something new to try out.
New post from jsorge.net: My First Swift Package
Mariners walk off! What a game!

I’m writing a little thing that will take my markdown files and make them textbundles and want to embed images in the bundle.

Is a regular expression the best way to get any image names from that file?
I just realized I’ve been a 1Password customer for 10 years now. It’s easily in my pantheon of apps I couldn’t live without.

Sad day: My Fluid app for GitHub is considered an “old browser” and is starting to break on me. I emailed the developer of Fluid and hope to get a good response, but it hasn’t been updated in so long that I’m not optimistic.

Any other good way to silo a web app on the Mac?
Ok, I got the site working locally. Victory! Next would be porting over my Ghost template to Jekyll. That’s a battle for another day.

I’m trying to get a Jekyll instance running locally and I keep running into Ruby and Gems issues. I’ve only used Ruby for Cocoapods and the Gems concept is all new to me. Maybe this isn’t the blog engine for me.
Star Wars in the style of Arrested Development is the video we all need to see today.

Reminder to my future self: setting the delegate property on a UINavigationController subclass doesn’t always do what I think it will do. In the case of the MFMessageComposeViewController, I needed to set the messageComposeDelegate instead.
New post from jsorge.net: View Controllers Make Crummy Navigators
The only reason it’s not insane for parents to pick up after their kids day after day after day is that they don’t expect different results.

I’m having this really weird and aggravating problem where some Apple Music songs will not play on my iPhone X but they will play on other devices. Hoping Apple’s support can get to the bottom of it. I’ve restarted the phone a few times to no avail.
I’ve totally bought in on the Shaquem Griffin hype train. I’m stoked to see him in Seattle. Go Hawks!
New post from jsorge.net: Childlike Faith
When someone leaves a card for their service on your door intended for new customers, they should probably find out if you are already a customer.
Sad day. Apple is officially discontinuing the AirPort line. I guess my next wireless setup will probably be an Eero or some mesh thing. But I’m holding onto my AirPort Extreme until it dies.
Achievement unlocked: An Xcode Clean failure. Never seen that before!
It takes a special kind of not caring to crack open a Corona at the transit center.
Not a bad view from the train. It’s finally getting nice in Seattle!
I get to ride the train home today! Emily and the boys are meeting me at the station. It truly is the best way to commute.

Dave DeLong has added a fifth chapter to his Better MVC series. The whole thing is worth a read. I love how he explains his thought processes and how he’s changed over the last several months of writing, speaking, and looking at Apple’s examples.
When I can’t blog about something, I’m really glad to have Day One.
Swift 4’s multi-line string literals are amazing!
